item.title: Abandoned Vehicle MG ZS, Reg: KV70 FDK, Upper Clapton E5 9LA, 10th July
item.description:
Dear Hackney Council, There is a white MG ZS (Reg: KV70 FDK) that appears abandoned near Winslade House, Upper Clapton, E5 9LA. The car has rear damage, flat tyres, hasn’t moved in a long time, and is parked by double yellow lines. Photos are attached.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Upper Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping blocking access, 10th July
item.description:
URGENT this has been reported a few weeks ago and nothing has been done, household waste, door builders bag, a Barrell has been dumped and cannot access there back gate, if there was an emergency please can this be cleared urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No ball games allowed signs not visible, 10th July
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern regarding the current signage on the playing field. Although there is a sign that states "No Ball Games Allowed," it has become significantly faded and is no longer clearly visible to the public. As a result, children have recently started playing on the field, unaware of the restriction. To ensure the safety of the children and to maintain the intended use of the space, I kindly request that more visible and durable signage be installed. Ideally, signs should be placed at both ends of the grass area to ensure they are easily seen from all directions. Clear and prominent signage will help prevent any misunderstandings and ensure that the rules are respected by all visitors.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Withens Close, St Mary Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unattended planters, 10th July
item.description:
Co-Op end of shops - Halfway Street Getting very shabby in comparison to area further into Sidcup.The brick planters by the Co-Op never have any attention - absolutely full of weeds, bits of rubbish and now some white foam type substance over the brickwork. The planters surrounding Sidcup station are very well maintained so it doesn’t seem to be for financial reasons. If the council are stretched and cannot care for these planters at all maybe they should be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 184, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
